page.title: 14STAINTON QUARRY.
page.content: The land is owned by the Duke of Devonshire Estates. It is leased to Tilcon who pay a royalty for each tonne produced. 5,5oo tonnes are produced a week. Limestone chippings are sent to Norway from Barrow docks. They use hydro electricity to make aceytaline gas from the limestone chippings. The manager said there is enough limestone in the quarry to last 50 years. They blast with explosives. The quarry employs 13 people. 3 loading sovels, 3 plant operators, 1 dumper driver, 1 driller, 1 lab. tachnician, 1 clerk, 1 manager, 1 dept. manager, 1 fitter.
